page.title: 02ARNE PENINSULA-POOLE HARBOUR
page.content: The manor of Arne was originally in the possession of Shaftesbury Abbey from 948 AD. In Tudor times it passed to George Pitt. The main value of the area came from the saltings originally and later the deposits of ball clay, apart from farming and some smuggling. Thomas Hyde, an important Poole merchent, obtained ball clay mining rights in the 18th century,built a manor house and then went bankrupt in 1792. In the 19th century the population of Arne was much greater than now, being 80 men of which 17 were agricultural labourers in 1841. Arne was completely evacuated during World War Two when it was used as a military training ground. The Nature Reserve was set up in 1965.
